pr_title: Add docs for data_compression table property in SQLServer

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if this is enforced, but better to left-align the text with the header line.
timeline.author: phd3
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -90,6 +90,29 @@ following aggregate functions:
 * :func:`var_pop`
 * :func:`var_samp`
 
+Table Properties
+----------------
+
+Table property usage example:
+
+.. code-block:: sql
+
+    CREATE TABLE myschema.scientists (
+      recordkey VARCHAR,
+      name VARCHAR,
+      age BIGINT,
+      birthday DATE
+    )
+    WITH (
+      data_compression = 'ROW'
+    );
+
+==================== ================ ======================================================================================================
+Property Name        Default Value    Description
+==================== ================ ======================================================================================================
+``data_compression``   (none)           DataCompression for SQL Server tables. Can either be `NONE`, 'ROW` or `PAGE`.

replies.bodyText: Dont use a table if it is only one property at all. And in general might be better to use list-table (see other documentation for examples)
replies.author: mosabua

timeline.bodyText: DataCompression -> May be Data compression policy? Also, what's the difference between (none) and NONE here?
timeline.author: phd3
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -90,6 +90,29 @@ following aggregate functions:
 * :func:`var_pop`
 * :func:`var_samp`

+----------------
+

+

+      recordkey VARCHAR,
+      name VARCHAR,
+      age BIGINT,
+      birthday DATE
+    )
+    WITH (

+==================== ================ ======================================================================================================
+Property Name        Default Value    Description
+==================== ================ ======================================================================================================
+``data_compression``   (none)           DataCompression for SQL Server tables. Can either be `NONE`, 'ROW` or `PAGE`.

timeline.bodyText: @Praveen2112 thoughts providing some SQLServer reference here that explains the properties in more detail?
timeline.author: phd3

replies.bodyText: well... is any property supported? If yes.. we should list them all or link to documentation where they are listed.
replies.author: mosabua

replies.bodyText: As of now we support only one property.
replies.author: Praveen2112

timeline.bodyText:
I would get rid of this sentence and instead embed the link in the sentence above
You can specify the `data compression policy for SQL Server tables <url>`_ ....
timeline.author: mosabua
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -90,6 +90,28 @@ following aggregate functions:
 * :func:`var_pop`
 * :func:`var_samp`
 
+Table property ``data_compression``
+-----------------------------------
+
+You can specify the data compression policy for SQL Server tables with the ``data_compression``
+Valid policies are ``NONE``, ``ROW`` or ``PAGE``.
+
+See `Data Compression

timeline.author: mosabua
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -90,6 +90,25 @@ following aggregate functions:
 * :func:`var_pop`
 * :func:`var_samp`
 
+Table property ``data_compression``
+-----------------------------------
+
+You can specify the `data compression policy for SQL Server tables
+<https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/data-compression/data-compression>`_
+with the ``data_compression``. Valid policies are ``NONE``, ``ROW`` or ``PAGE``.
